case_vignette: A 35-year-old woman presents to the dermatology clinic with inflammation of her fingernails that first appeared 5 months ago and recently worsened! She reports wearing acrylic nails for the last year, removing them just before the clinic visit! On examination, the patient has erythema and swelling of the lateral nail folds and hyperpigmentation of the proximal nail folds of all fingers on her right hand! Examination also reveals nail dystrophy, onycholysis, and an absence of cuticles! She has not tried any treatments for this condition!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have redness and swelling around my fingernails, some darkening around the base of my nails, nail damage, nail detachment, and my cuticles are gone.
How long have you had these symptoms?
I've had these symptoms for about 5 months, and they have recently gotten worse.
Do you have a history of frequent hand washing or exposure to chemicals?
No, I do not have a history of frequent hand washing or exposure to chemicals.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently on any medication?
I have not mentioned any other medical conditions or medications.
Is there any history of similar nail issues or autoimmune diseases in your family?
I haven't mentioned any family history of similar nail issues or autoimmune diseases.
Final Diagnosis: Acute Paronychia

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

Hello! I have redness and swelling around my fingernails, the skin near the base of my nails has darkened, my nails are misshapen, some of my nails are detaching from the nail bed, and my cuticles are missing.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for about 5 months.
Do you have a history of psoriasis, or does anyone in your family have it?
No, I do not have a history of psoriasis and no one in my family has it.
Have you had any recent exposures to water or chemicals, especially those involved in your occupation or hobbies?
I have been wearing acrylic nails for the last year.
Final Diagnosis: Acrylic nail-induced nail dystrophy.

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have inflammation around my fingernails, swelling, redness, nail damage, my nails are separating from the skin, and the skin near my nail roots has turned darker.
Have you had any recent injuries or infections to your hands or nails?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or infections to my hands or nails.
Do you have a history of psoriasis or any other skin conditions?
No, I don't have a history of psoriasis or any other skin conditions.
Are you currently taking any medications or have you started using any new products that could have come into contact with your hands?
No, I am not currently taking any medications or using any new products that could have come into contact with my hands.
Do you have any other symptoms elsewhere on your body, or is it localized only around your nails?
It is localized only around my nails.
Final Diagnosis: Acrodermatitis continua of Hallopeau
